article.headline: Miami (Ohio) 59, IUPUI 58
article.story: OXFORD, Ohio -- Julian Mavunga scored 17 points and Antonio Ballard added 14 as Miami (Ohio) held on to beat IUPUI 59-58 on Saturday night. The RedHawks (2-1) trailed 22-21 at halftime after shooting 8 for 26 (30.8 percent), including 1 of 8 from 3-point range in the first half. Ballard and Mavunga scored 12 points apiece in the second half as Miami shot 13 of 21 (61.9 percent) to pull in front 50-49 with 3:49 left to play. Mavunga nailed a 3-pointer to push the Miami lead to 53-49 with less than three minutes remaining as the RedHawks led by no less than two points the rest of the way until Stephen Thomas hit a 3-pointer with 10 seconds left to pull the Jaguars within one, 59-58. Alex Young scored a game-high 23 points on 9-of-22 (40.9 percent) shooting for IUPUI in the loss. The Jaguars led by as many as seven, 41-34, with 10:09 left in the game.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
